docs.title: Welcome to StreamController
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in this app, it is a lot of work developing it.

docs.title: GitHub:
docs.text:
This is currently the only way to install StreamController, because it is still in heavy development. 

git clone https://github.com/Core447/StreamController


cd StreamController


pip install -r requirements.txt
Finished! Open the app by running python3 main.py

docs.title: Create Your Own Plugin
docs.text:
To get the most out of StreamController you can easily create your own plugin.

And the best of it is that there are just four major steps to get started with developing your own plugin:

  1. Come up with an idea
  2. Fork the plugin template (coming soon)
  3. Modify the template
  4. Submit your plugin to the Store

Ok, ok, that was probably a bit too quick, so let's take a closer look at the process.

docs.title: 1. Come up with an idea
docs.text:
The first but hardest step. But because you opened this page, I assume you have already something great in mind.

If not I suggest you to think about problems, or inefficient task on your computer that you want to solve.

docs.title: 2. Download StreamController's source code
docs.text:
2.1 Clone StreamController from GitHub by typing:

git clone https://github.com/Core447/StreamController

2.2 Enter the StreamController directory:

cd StreamController

2.3 Enter the plugins directory:

cd plugins

2.4 Clone the PluginTemplate from GitHub by typing:

git clone https://github.com/Core447/PluginTemplate

This will create a new directory called PluginTemplate in the plugins directory with a bunch of files. But no worry, I will explain each of them in the next section.

docs.title: Plugin Development
docs.text:
No app is perfect for everyone because each one has different needs and personal preferences. That's why I decided to give such people the opportunity to develop their own plugins completely adapted to your needs.

The StreamController app features advanced plugin support to allow developers as you to easily create plugins in Python. In fact the main reason I choose Python for StreamController is that the plugins can also be written in Python. Which is a easy to learn language.

docs.title: Official Plugins
docs.text:
There are several official plugins for StreamController:

  • OBS
  • Media
  • Deck
  • OS
